subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to write effective tests?
msgSnippet: Hi all, With respect to the question How to write effective tests .I want to point out one related question also that How we will conclude that the test
messageBody:
Hi all,

With respect to the question 'How to write
effective
tests".I want to point out one related question
also that "How we will conclude that the test cases
that we designed is suficient".

Effectiveness and sufficiency of test cases what we
designed can ensure that only if we are designing the
test cases in a formal methodological manner.For that
we have to think through the business logic of the
requirement for which we are going to design test
cases.
If we are following a method like this,we can ensure
that the number of test cases we designed is
sufficient and effective(no more ,no less. if less
something missed and if more something repeating).
Why i explained this is, there is a tool named
'Orchid'
which will help us to design the test cases in a
formal methodological manner.This tool is developed by
a Bangalore based testing company 'stag software'.
We can down load and evaluate this tool from the site

www.stagsoftware.com
Looking forward ur comments,
San.


--- Carl Hume <chume@...> wrote: > Hey Dave,
>
> Did you announce your book on the TDD list? I must
> have missed it... When
> is it due for publishing?
>
> Cheers!
> Carl
